channel.title: So I want to start a Delta
channel.description:
Sup guys, just a little story about me and a few questions ;)
I have been coding RsPs since 2009 and I have always coded on a Delta base server. About a year ago I quited the RsPs scene playing/coding scene and moved on to coding in another langauge then Java.
However while browsering Youtube and finding old video's that my players made while my Delta was online in the past I kinda missed the feeling to own a server that you are proud of because I spend so much time developing content for the players.
Everyone that hosted a server knows what I am talking about :-)
I decided to message some old buddy's and since 2 weeks ago I started to work on my Delta again. Because I recently went to a school that focus on programming software and websites I looked to coding another way and I have achieved things that I couldnt have done before. Probably for the most of you simple things like creating a webclient.
There is just one big problem with Delta that always has been there but I just do not know what to do against it. You might gues it already; [b]Networking[/b]
I think that I am pretty good in developing content on my server but the problem is that I do not know anything about the networking in Delta. I am sure that my server cannot hold more then 60 players online at once (I reached that before). It just starts lagging, nulling and crashing. I just dont know what to do with it and it was and is always a big problem.
I would really like to learn more about how the networking is done and ways to improve it but I just dont know where to start. I have considered to pay for developers that could do this for me but I want to do it my self so I can be proud when I release it back to the community.
Could anyone give me a hint to the right direction? Should I just follow Java tutorials and thats it? Or what?
inb4 We do not care
Thank you,
- Youri

item.title: So I want to start a Delta
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Obviously you saw it on r-s lololololol

Read full topic

item.title: So I want to start a Delta
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:5, topic:478480”][quote author=youridudock link=topic=596705.msg4201403#msg4201403 date=1358253866]
Does packaging really help the server performance?
[/quote]

It’s purpose is for organization, structure, and design. Who told you that this will improve function and performance…?

P.S. If you like, I can remove unneeded content/features/checks and turn the Base over to you; free of charge. You’ll just owe me a favor.[/quote]

Not sure who told me that, I think I have read it on Rune-Server.

Anyways thanks for your offer, I will send you a PM right now.

Read full topic
item.source: So I want to start a Delta

@Team_Rocket wrote:

youridudock:

Does packaging really help the server performance?

It’s purpose is for organization, structure, and design. Who told you that this will improve function and performance…?

P.S. If you like, I can remove unneeded content/features/checks and turn the Base over to you; free of charge. You’ll just owe me a favor.

item.source: So I want to start a Delta

item.title: So I want to start a Delta
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

You would be better off using a PI over Delta. Networking is better, but the only problem is the shit crammed into process(). I suggest cleaning out your server and using the most efficient and stable code possible. That would help, but would not solve your problems. Delta servers are hard to get right.

The only thing that got me back into RsPs is to code a Delta on my own server. I do not want to start learning another server type from start again. It just doesnt feel as ‘my server’ because there are 1k + servers out there that use the same cache (almost the same cache). I also like the old school look from Delta.

Hope you understand me.

Also I am not sure if it is allowed but does anyone know a ‘okay’ developer that can do this? I want to try to arrange a deal.

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:3, topic:478480”]start by:

removing the thread per client model, which would mean no more blocking IO
clean out processing
improve design throughout

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,589274.0.html take some ideas from that if you want it started out as a delta[/quote]

Your server looks very good. Only I really just want to use my server.

Does packaging really help the server performance?

Read full topic
item.source: So I want to start a Delta
